editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: Everyone needs a task manager – and this Apple Design Award winner is adaptable enough for anyone. Organising items is as simple as dragging them where you want them, and the Magic Plus button makes it easy to add to-dos from anywhere in the app.

The infection has begun and it’s up to you to strategically spread and evolve a deadly plague to bring about the end of the human race. Saving the world and being a hero is honourable, but decimating the world with a deadly infection is a whole lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

editorialNotes.standard: Something happened to your fellow children – and the only way to learn their fates is by sneaking past menacing shadows in this chilling 2D platformer.

name: 剑之痕-经典格斗动作手游
artistName: 上海绽放网络科技有限公司

editorialNotes.standard: Is it a silhouette of two faces, or is it a picture of a vase? In the spirit of that classic optical illusion, Voi is an elegant shape-matching puzzler that makes you think about what isn’t there as much as what is. An accessible, zen-like experience with no time limits and no pressure, it’s simultaneously challenging and calming.

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALL·E directed by Tim Burton—that’s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robot’s quest for love combines tons more influences—like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic books—for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome “aha!” moments, it’s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

We haven’t seen hoverboarding this cool since the Back to the Future flicks. Oddrok’s fantastic action game lets you grind rails and shoot through half-pipes in levels stuffed with surprises. Rival boarders drop bombs in your path; towering sandworms and lethal lasers dare you to come near. The whole time, an energetic soundtrack and swooping camera give Power Hover an exhilarating, cinematic feel that’s like pure adrenaline.
